title: What are the key Authentication Methods?
description: Discover how systems verify your identity to grant access. From the traditional to the cutting-edge.

words.fact: Password Authentication: Most common method using a secret string of characters. Best practices include using strong, unique passwords with a mix of letters, numbers, and symbols. Vulnerable to brute force and phishing attacks.

Biometric Authentication: Uses unique physical characteristics like fingerprints, facial recognition, iris scans, or voice patterns. Highly secure as biological traits are difficult to replicate or steal.

Token-Based Authentication: Physical or digital device that generates time-sensitive codes. Examples include hardware tokens, authenticator apps (Google Authenticator, Authy), and SMS codes. Key component of multi-factor authentication (MFA).

Certificate-Based Authentication: Uses digital certificates issued by trusted authorities to verify identity. Common in enterprise environments, VPNs, and secure communications. Based on public key infrastructure (PKI).
